heisig_chinese_memo: Here Spiderman found his long lost twin who uses silk threads for his suit instead of cotton like our Spidey who is a bit cheaper.
Ru_trainchinese:
sī: (сущ) шелк
sī: (графема/сч.слово) струнные инструменты; немного, небольшое количество
sī: (сущ) нитевидный предмет
Kanshudo_mnemonic: two threads (糸) make a bigger thread
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Silk thread is at least double the cost of normal thread.
origin_of_ch_char_book: In ancient times people made a rope by combining straws one after another. When they made ropes, they thought of the ropes as symbolizing the descendants because of how the rope continues on. The (孫, 孙, sun, grandchild) reflects their thoughts. The character symbolizes “grandchild” by combining child (子, zi=tzu, child) and rope (絲, 丝, si=ssu, silk). These two combinations came to mean future generation, the descendants, or a grandchild.
humanum_full_description_en:
"Said Wen": "Silk, silkworm spit out. From Ershi . All silk belongs to silk." Inscription " 𢆶 " is the provincial language of " silk ", " 𢆶 ", " silk " oracle bone inscriptions There are differences in usage, but the usage of inscriptions is mixed, see " 𢆶 ".

The oracle bone inscription is suspected to be the official name, and the bronze inscription is used as the original meaning of silk. And as a demonstrative pronoun, classics as " Have ." Chang Ding: "Use 𢆶(here) Jin Zha (as) Zhenwen to study the white Ding Niu Ding".
humanum_short_description_en: " Silk " inscriptions from the second "糸", like two bundles of silk, the original meaning is silk thread.
humanum_full_description:
《說文》：「絲，蠶所吐也。从二糸。凡絲之屬皆从絲。」甲金文「𢆶」是「絲」的省文，「𢆶」、「絲」甲骨文用法有別，金文始見用法相混，參見「𢆶」。

　　甲骨文疑為職官名，金文用作本義，表示蠶絲，曶鼎：「用匹馬束絲」。又用作指示代詞，典籍作「茲」。曶鼎：「用𢆶(茲)金乍(作)朕文考宄白䵼牛鼎」。
humanum_short_description: 「絲」甲金文從二「糸」，象兩束絲之形，本義是絲線。

origin_of_ch_char_book: In ancient times people made a rope by combining straws one after another. When they made ropes, they thought of the ropes as symbolizing the descendants because of how the rope continues on. The (孫, 孙, sun, grandchild) reflects their thoughts. The character symbolizes “grandchild” by combining child (子, zi=tzu, child) and rope (絲, 丝, si=ssu, silk). These two combinations came to mean future generation, the descendants, or a grandchild.
絲絲RS silk, fine thread, wire, strings
  • many strings 糸糸
(Simplified: 丝)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: Finely-layered 糹silk 糸; 糹 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 糸 [ mì ] silk; thread
①蠶吐出的像線的東西，是織綢緞等的原料：蠶絲。絲綢。緙絲(中國特有的一種絲織的手工藝品。亦作“刻絲”)。
②像絲的東西：鐵絲。菌絲。肉絲。遊絲。
③細微，極小：一絲不苟。
④綿長的思緒或感情：情絲。愁絲。
⑤中國市制重量單位(一絲等於千分之一分)：絲毫(喻極少，極小，一點兒)。絲恩髮怨(指極小的恩怨)。
⑥公制長度單位，一米的十萬分之一(亦稱“忽米”、“道”)。
⑦指絃樂器：絲竹(琴、瑟、簫、笛等樂器的總稱。“竹”指管樂器)。
⑧中國古代樂器八音之一。

《說文》：「絲，蠶所吐也。从二糸。凡絲之屬皆从絲。」甲金文「 𢆶 」是「 絲 」的省文，「 𢆶 」、「 絲 」甲骨文用法有別，金文始見用法相混，參見「 𢆶 」。 甲骨文疑為職官名，金文用作本義，表示蠶絲，曶鼎：「用匹馬束絲」。又用作指示代詞，典籍作「 茲 」。曶鼎：「用𢆶(茲)金乍(作)朕文考宄白䵼牛鼎」。
"Said Wen": "Silk, silkworm spit out. From Ershi. All silk belongs to silk." Inscription" 𢆶" is the provincial language of " silk", " 𢆶", " silk" oracle bone inscriptions There are differences in usage, but the usage of inscriptions is mixed, see " 𢆶". The oracle bone inscription is suspected to be the official name, and the bronze inscription is used as the original meaning of silk. And as a demonstrative pronoun, classics as " Have." Chang Ding: "Use 𢆶(here) Jin Zha (as) Zhenwen to study the white Ding Niu Ding".

絲字的基本解释

絲
sī
见“丝”。

絲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sī］
［《廣韻》息兹切，平之，心。］
“丝1”的繁体字。
(1)蚕丝。
(2)泛指像蚕丝一样的细缕。
(3)食品切成丝状者亦称丝。
(4)线。
(5)丝织品。
(6)缫丝；纺丝。
(7)喻指白发。
(8)比喻极微细的东西。
(9)量词。相传为古代计丝之量词。
(10)量词。长度或重量的微量。十忽为一丝，十丝为一毫。
(11)量词。表示极小或极少的量。
(12)八音之一，指琴、瑟、琵琶等弦乐器。

絲字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　絲； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页924第03
【廣韻】息兹切【集韻】【韻會】新兹切，?音思。【說文】蠶所吐也。【急就篇註】抽引精繭出緒曰絲。【書·禹貢】厥貢漆絲。【詩·召南】素絲五紽。【周禮·天官·大宰】?婦化治絲枲。又【典絲】掌絲入而辨其物。【左傳·隱四年】猶治絲而棼之也。　又【周禮·春官·大師】皆播之以八音：金石土革絲木匏竹。【註】絲，琴瑟也。　又【禮·緇衣】王言如絲。【疏】微細如絲。　【五經文字】絲作?，譌。【韻會】俗作〈糹系〉，誤。○按《說文》絲自爲部，今倂入。

絲字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
絲字的起名意思

暂无。

wire
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [sī]
["Guangyun" Xiziqi, Pingzhi, Heart. ]
Traditional characters for "丝1".
(1) Silk.
(2) Generally refers to fine strands like silk.
(3) The food cut into silk is also called silk.
(4) Line.
(5) Silk fabrics.
(6) Silk reeling; spinning.
(7) Yu refers to gray hair.
(8) A metaphor for very subtle things.
(9) Quantifiers. According to legend, it is the quantifier of ancient silk counting.
(10) Quantifiers. A trace of length or weight. Tens are a bit, and ten are a bit.
(11) Quantifiers. Indicates a very small or very small amount.
(12) One of the eight tones, refers to stringed instruments such as the piano, ce, and pipa.
wire

[Guangyun] Xiziqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Xinziqie,? Yinsi. [Said the text] The silkworm vomits. [Jijiupian Note] Draw the cocoon out of the thread and call it silk. 【Book·Yugong】Jue Gong lacquered silk. 【Poetry·Zhaonan】Five-flavored silk. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】? Fu Hua Zhi Si Da. Also 【Diansi】The palm silk enters and distinguishes the thing. [Zuo Zhuan·Hidden Four Years] You control the silk and confuse it.　[Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Master] are broadcast with eight sounds: gold, stone, earth, leather, silk, wood, bamboo. [Note] Silk, Qin Se also.　[Li·Yiyi] Wang Yan is like silk. 【Sparse】fine as silk.　[Text of the Five Classics] Silk made?, Jiao. [Rhyme Club] The popular work "Zao Series", wrong. ○According to "Shuowen", silk is a part of its own, and today it is stunned.
